values.description:
Fix issue #23.

* Instead of pressing 'r' or 't' keys to change between translate and rotate modes, now there's a button on the toolbar to change modes.
 
* Changing with the keyboard deactivated ('r' and 't' keys)
 
* The rotate.png image was taken from the gazebo repository and resized.

* The manipulator stays attached to a model when switching between rotate and translate
values.title: Add a rotate button

summary.raw:
Fix issue #23.

* Instead of pressing 'r' or 't' keys to change between translate and rotate modes, now there's a button on the toolbar to change modes.
 
* Changing with the keyboard deactivated ('r' and 't' keys)
 
* The rotate.png image was taken from the gazebo repository and resized.

* The manipulator stays attached to a model when switching between rotate and translate
summary.html:
Fix issue #23.

  • Instead of pressing 'r' or 't' keys to change between translate and rotate modes, now there's a button on the toolbar to change modes.

  • Changing with the keyboard deactivated ('r' and 't' keys)

  • The rotate.png image was taken from the gazebo repository and resized.

  • The manipulator stays attached to a model when switching between rotate and translate

values.description:
fix for issue #26

problem was that the model manipulator was still attached to the tmp model used for object placement (which is then removed just before sending the msg to the server to create the entity).  

this patch changes mode so the model manipulator gets detached.
values.title: Switch to arrow mode when spawning models

summary.raw:
fix for issue #26

problem was that the model manipulator was still attached to the tmp model used for object placement (which is then removed just before sending the msg to the server to create the entity).  

this patch changes mode so the model manipulator gets detached.
summary.html:
fix for issue #26

problem was that the model manipulator was still attached to the tmp model used for object placement (which is then removed just before sending the msg to the server to create the entity).

this patch changes mode so the model manipulator gets detached.

values.description:
`advertise` msgs get incorrectly parsed in `GazeboInterface` as `publish` messages.

Ignore it otherwise it generates an error message when spawning a model for the first time.

issue #28
values.title: Fix message parsing which were causing spawn model error msgs to be printed

Ignore it otherwise it generates an error message when spawning a model for the first time.

issue #28

values.description:
* This substitutes the interface based on `jQuery-UI` with one based on `jQuery Mobile` (they're incompatible)
* Desktop only (touch not there yet)
* Deleted `jQuery-UI` files
* Added `jQuery Mobile` files
* Mode icons (view|translate|rotate) back to lighter shade
* Shape icons not used yet (sphere|cylinder|box)
* Play/Pause icons adapted from Gazebo
* index.html and gzgui.js reflect the new interface
* window.innerWidth and innerHeight substituted with window.containerWidth and containerHeight to take header and footer into account
* Spawned shapes show transparent before being placed to differentiate from existing ones
* JSDoc documentation (inline comments)
values.title: jQueryMobile interface for desktop version

summary.raw:
* This substitutes the interface based on `jQuery-UI` with one based on `jQuery Mobile` (they're incompatible)
* Desktop only (touch not there yet)
* Deleted `jQuery-UI` files
* Added `jQuery Mobile` files
* Mode icons (view|translate|rotate) back to lighter shade
* Shape icons not used yet (sphere|cylinder|box)
* Play/Pause icons adapted from Gazebo
* index.html and gzgui.js reflect the new interface
* window.innerWidth and innerHeight substituted with window.containerWidth and containerHeight to take header and footer into account
* Spawned shapes show transparent before being placed to differentiate from existing ones
* JSDoc documentation (inline comments)
summary.html:
• This substitutes the interface based on jQuery-UI with one based on jQuery Mobile (they're incompatible)
  • Desktop only (touch not there yet)
  • Deleted jQuery-UI files
  • Added jQuery Mobile files
  • Mode icons (view|translate|rotate) back to lighter shade
  • Shape icons not used yet (sphere|cylinder|box)
  • Play/Pause icons adapted from Gazebo
  • index.html and gzgui.js reflect the new interface
  • window.innerWidth and innerHeight substituted with window.containerWidth and containerHeight to take header and footer into account
  • Spawned shapes show transparent before being placed to differentiate from existing ones
  • JSDoc documentation (inline comments)

values.description:
Fix issue #30.

* [Gazebo's grid](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6f357235d464f26f5ffc61f90e17e67f788703f5/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc?at=default#cl-2695) is composed of 2 grids:

1.  20x20, step = 1, color (0.3,0.3,0.3,0.5)
2. 4x4, step = 5, color (0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 0.5)

* Gzweb uses Three.js's [GridHelper](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/extras/helpers/GridHelper.js), which is a combination of 2 grids by default, but one of them is just a cross following X and Y. [This](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT390) changes the default colors to those of Gazebo's.

* Also changes Gzweb's rendered [ClearColor](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT22) to `#b2b2b2` (178,178,178) to match Gazebo's background color.

* The floor plane (Gazebo's ambient) is receiving the color Gazebo/Grey, so I didn't want to change it.

* [Gazebo's ambient light](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6f357235d464f26f5ffc61f90e17e67f788703f5/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc?at=default#cl-270) is (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1). Three.js's ambient light does not take an alpha value, so setting it to `#1a1a1a` (0.1, 0.1, 0.1) illuminates too much. I chose [a value](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT28) so that after illumination, the floor gets the same color on both Gazebo and Gzweb: `#9b9b9b`.

* After illumination, the grids have slightly different colors.

* [These screenshots](https://www.dropbox.com/s/mt8t8faf2syf6wd/gzwebColors.png) show the results.

If a 4x4 lighter grid like Gazebo's is preferred, we will have to reconstruct Three.js's GridHelper from scratch.

I'm not sure if the change is ambient light has a wanted effect on different models put in the scene.
values.title: Fixing scene colors

summary.raw:
Fix issue #30.

* [Gazebo's grid](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6f357235d464f26f5ffc61f90e17e67f788703f5/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc?at=default#cl-2695) is composed of 2 grids:

1.  20x20, step = 1, color (0.3,0.3,0.3,0.5)
2. 4x4, step = 5, color (0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 0.5)

* Gzweb uses Three.js's [GridHelper](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/extras/helpers/GridHelper.js), which is a combination of 2 grids by default, but one of them is just a cross following X and Y. [This](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT390) changes the default colors to those of Gazebo's.

* Also changes Gzweb's rendered [ClearColor](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT22) to `#b2b2b2` (178,178,178) to match Gazebo's background color.

* The floor plane (Gazebo's ambient) is receiving the color Gazebo/Grey, so I didn't want to change it.

* [Gazebo's ambient light](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6f357235d464f26f5ffc61f90e17e67f788703f5/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc?at=default#cl-270) is (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1). Three.js's ambient light does not take an alpha value, so setting it to `#1a1a1a` (0.1, 0.1, 0.1) illuminates too much. I chose [a value](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-request/18/fixing-scene-colors/diff#Lgz3d/src/gzscene.jsT28) so that after illumination, the floor gets the same color on both Gazebo and Gzweb: `#9b9b9b`.

* After illumination, the grids have slightly different colors.

* [These screenshots](https://www.dropbox.com/s/mt8t8faf2syf6wd/gzwebColors.png) show the results.

If a 4x4 lighter grid like Gazebo's is preferred, we will have to reconstruct Three.js's GridHelper from scratch.

I'm not sure if the change is ambient light has a wanted effect on different models put in the scene.
summary.html:
Fix issue #30.

  • Gazebo's grid is composed of 2 grids:
  1. 20x20, step = 1, color (0.3,0.3,0.3,0.5)
  2. 4x4, step = 5, color (0.8, 0.8, 0.8, 0.5)

  • Gzweb uses Three.js's GridHelper, which is a combination of 2 grids by default, but one of them is just a cross following X and Y. This changes the default colors to those of Gazebo's.

  • Also changes Gzweb's rendered ClearColor to #b2b2b2 (178,178,178) to match Gazebo's background color.

  • The floor plane (Gazebo's ambient) is receiving the color Gazebo/Grey, so I didn't want to change it.

  • Gazebo's ambient light is (0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1). Three.js's ambient light does not take an alpha value, so setting it to #1a1a1a (0.1, 0.1, 0.1) illuminates too much. I chose a value so that after illumination, the floor gets the same color on both Gazebo and Gzweb: #9b9b9b.

  • After illumination, the grids have slightly different colors.

  • These screenshots show the results.

If a 4x4 lighter grid like Gazebo's is preferred, we will have to reconstruct Three.js's GridHelper from scratch.

I'm not sure if the change is ambient light has a wanted effect on different models put in the scene.

values.description:
* Copy from original mesh: `asset`, `library_images`, `library_materials`, `library_effects` (no more need for hard-coded default values)

* `library_visual_scenes` cannot be copied directly, at least the `scale`: for PR2, for example, the original mesh has a 0.1 scale, but at that scale the simplified mesh shows too small. My guess is that this scaling is converted when importing the original mesh to Gazebo.

* I was able to simplify and load on gzweb: `pr2`, `bowl`, `drc_practice_ladder`, but not `coke_can`

* The texture coordinates are not well converted yet, as seen on this [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4dxoerdi8bgh021/gzcoarsePR2.png).
values.title: Clean gzcoarse.cc

summary.raw:
* Copy from original mesh: `asset`, `library_images`, `library_materials`, `library_effects` (no more need for hard-coded default values)

* `library_visual_scenes` cannot be copied directly, at least the `scale`: for PR2, for example, the original mesh has a 0.1 scale, but at that scale the simplified mesh shows too small. My guess is that this scaling is converted when importing the original mesh to Gazebo.

* I was able to simplify and load on gzweb: `pr2`, `bowl`, `drc_practice_ladder`, but not `coke_can`

* The texture coordinates are not well converted yet, as seen on this [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4dxoerdi8bgh021/gzcoarsePR2.png).
summary.html:
• Copy from original mesh: asset, library_images, library_materials, library_effects (no more need for hard-coded default values)

  • library_visual_scenes cannot be copied directly, at least the scale: for PR2, for example, the original mesh has a 0.1 scale, but at that scale the simplified mesh shows too small. My guess is that this scaling is converted when importing the original mesh to Gazebo.

  • I was able to simplify and load on gzweb: pr2, bowl, drc_practice_ladder, but not coke_can

  • The texture coordinates are not well converted yet, as seen on this screenshot.

values.description:
- simplify build process by including a call to the command `npm install` in `deploy.sh`

- node modules are now installed locally to avoid the need for `sudo` priviledges when running `deploy.sh`

- add osx support

- switch to use `webify_models_v2.py` script. Converted textures are now properly placed in `materials/textures` folder and all references to them in dae files are updated. Old script also has problem with some gazebo models and `media` files on osx.

- address issue #33
values.title: Update deploy process

summary.raw:
- simplify build process by including a call to the command `npm install` in `deploy.sh`

- node modules are now installed locally to avoid the need for `sudo` priviledges when running `deploy.sh`

- add osx support

- switch to use `webify_models_v2.py` script. Converted textures are now properly placed in `materials/textures` folder and all references to them in dae files are updated. Old script also has problem with some gazebo models and `media` files on osx.

- address issue #33
summary.html:
• simplify build process by including a call to the command npm install in deploy.sh

  • node modules are now installed locally to avoid the need for sudo priviledges when running deploy.sh

  • add osx support

  • switch to use webify_models_v2.py script. Converted textures are now properly placed in materials/textures folder and all references to them in dae files are updated. Old script also has problem with some gazebo models and media files on osx.

  • address issue #33

values.description:
tidy up pull request #21 and target it to default

changes from original pull request:

- style fixes

- use boost condition variable for a blocking wait if there are no client connections

- prevent growing the message buffer when no clients

fix for issue #32
values.title: Minimize gzbridge load -> default

values.description:
Adds a menu to insert 3D models from the database.

* Tool to generate a thumbnail for each model
* Desktop: From insert menu, insert models by `click+hover+click` or `click+drag`
* Mobile: From insert menu, insert models by `tap+drag` or `long press+drag`
* For now, temp model during spawn is a box
values.title: Insert menu

summary.raw:
Adds a menu to insert 3D models from the database.

* Tool to generate a thumbnail for each model
* Desktop: From insert menu, insert models by `click+hover+click` or `click+drag`
* Mobile: From insert menu, insert models by `tap+drag` or `long press+drag`
* For now, temp model during spawn is a box
summary.html:
Adds a menu to insert 3D models from the database.

  • Tool to generate a thumbnail for each model
  • Desktop: From insert menu, insert models by click+hover+click or click+drag
  • Mobile: From insert menu, insert models by tap+drag or long press+drag
  • For now, temp model during spawn is a box

values.description:
* New `deploy.sh` which takes options `-h`, `-m`, `-m local` and `-c`
* `coarse_meshes.sh` which simplifies all meshes in a directory
* `gzcoarse.cc`: `Collada -> Gazebo -> GTS -> simplify -> GTS -> Gazebo -> Collada`
* `Gazebo -> Collada` very similar to `ColladaExporter.cc`
* `nanoflann.hpp` to create kd-tree
* `gziface.js` now loads coarse model, if available, when using mobiles
values.title: Mesh simplification for mobile devices

summary.raw:
* New `deploy.sh` which takes options `-h`, `-m`, `-m local` and `-c`
* `coarse_meshes.sh` which simplifies all meshes in a directory
* `gzcoarse.cc`: `Collada -> Gazebo -> GTS -> simplify -> GTS -> Gazebo -> Collada`
* `Gazebo -> Collada` very similar to `ColladaExporter.cc`
* `nanoflann.hpp` to create kd-tree
* `gziface.js` now loads coarse model, if available, when using mobiles
summary.html:
• New deploy.sh which takes options -h, -m, -m local and -c
  • coarse_meshes.sh which simplifies all meshes in a directory
  • gzcoarse.cc: Collada -> Gazebo -> GTS -> simplify -> GTS -> Gazebo -> Collada
  • Gazebo -> Collada very similar to ColladaExporter.cc
  • nanoflann.hpp to create kd-tree
  • gziface.js now loads coarse model, if available, when using mobiles

values.description:
Added the options `Transparent` and `Wireframe` to the object menu. 

For desktop they are on the context menu, and for touch they are on the radial menu.

Made some icons for the radial menu, but they can certainly be improved.

Screenshots: https://www.dropbox.com/s/0h31yk4z1r2ksxj/trans_wire.png
values.title: View Transparent and View Wireframe options to object menu

values.description:

Needed this in order to set up gzweb on Amazon t1 micro instances.

values.description:
* Kill camera control so there's no conflict. Navigation prevented when:

1.  inserting models (temp model attached to pointer)

2. using manipulator (manipulator hovered / dragged / touched)

3. using radial menu

4. pointer (mouse or touch) is over menu (for now only left panel)

* Radial menu shouldn't open during insert anymore

* Radial menu shouldn't keep appearing when long press changes place

* Improve handle / object selection (for example, when in translate mode, the hidden rotate handles don't interfere on object selection)
values.title: Change kill navigation logic, radial menu show fix, fix selecting handle

summary.raw:
* Kill camera control so there's no conflict. Navigation prevented when:

1.  inserting models (temp model attached to pointer)

2. using manipulator (manipulator hovered / dragged / touched)

3. using radial menu

4. pointer (mouse or touch) is over menu (for now only left panel)

* Radial menu shouldn't open during insert anymore

* Radial menu shouldn't keep appearing when long press changes place

* Improve handle / object selection (for example, when in translate mode, the hidden rotate handles don't interfere on object selection)
summary.html:
• Kill camera control so there's no conflict. Navigation prevented when:

  1. inserting models (temp model attached to pointer)

  2. using manipulator (manipulator hovered / dragged / touched)

  3. using radial menu

  4. pointer (mouse or touch) is over menu (for now only left panel)

  • Radial menu shouldn't open during insert anymore

  • Radial menu shouldn't keep appearing when long press changes place

  • Improve handle / object selection (for example, when in translate mode, the hidden rotate handles don't interfere on object selection)

values.description:
Depending on the camera angle, the wrong projection plane was being chosen, so the plane handles had unexpected behavior (such as translating on only one axis).

Changed the projection plane selection for the 3 plane manipulators and the octagon manipulator.

There might be a better way to group all the conditions, this is the best I could come up with for now...
values.title: Fix plane translation manipulation for desktop

summary.raw:
Depending on the camera angle, the wrong projection plane was being chosen, so the plane handles had unexpected behavior (such as translating on only one axis).

Changed the projection plane selection for the 3 plane manipulators and the octagon manipulator.

There might be a better way to group all the conditions, this is the best I could come up with for now...
summary.html:
Depending on the camera angle, the wrong projection plane was being chosen, so the plane handles had unexpected behavior (such as translating on only one axis).

Changed the projection plane selection for the 3 plane manipulators and the octagon manipulator.

There might be a better way to group all the conditions, this is the best I could come up with for now...

values.description:
Clicking on a model during view mode highlights it with a bounding box, and if the mode is changed to translate/rotate, manipulation handles get attached to that model.

Clicks/taps on screen and mode selection (from header toolbar, keyboard (r/t/esc), radial menu) should now work like this:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6fosaq4r99q6r8j/click.png

values.description:
A tiny yellow sphere to indicate the orbit point, translation origin and zoom focus.

Screen-shot:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/s13j3l5uuft87kc/targetIndicator1.png

Support for desktop:

* left-click translation origin

* scroll wheel click orbit point

* right-click zoom focus

* scroll wheel zoom focus (sphere shows until 400ms after the wheel stops moving)

Mobile support:

* 1-finger orbit point

* 2-finger pan origin (middle point)

* 2-finger zoom focus (middle point)

Obs:

* The bounding box steals the target if even remotely close to it, which always happens to small objects like simple shapes, but not for big objects like houses

* From below the ground, the target snaps to the grid

* The target when clicking the sky is the world origin
values.title: Camera control target indicator
